title: Hundreds of migrants still dying in Med five years since 2015
description: Five years on from the migrant crisis of 2015 hundreds are still dying in the Mediterranean.

title: George Ezra opens up about OCD struggle
description: The musician says he is plagued by intrusive thoughts, and has suffered from OCD "my whole life".

title: She got ill when the pandemic hit - and still is, six months later
description: For some people Covid just will not go away. One woman who thinks she had it has made an Instagram diary.

title: Meet Senegal's first female professional surfer
description: Khadjou Sambe, 25, defied social expectations to ride the Atlantic waves.

title: The 1980s 'super recession': This is what 3m unemployed looked like
description: As the UK copes with being in a recession, how does it compare with the recession in the 1980s?

title: Rival powers jockey for the lead in hypersonic aircraft
description: The US, China and Russia are pouring money into aircraft that can fly at five times the speed of sound.

title: Rohingya crisis: Growing up in the world's largest refugee camp
description: Nayeem, 3, is one of 20,000 children born every year in the camp in Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh.

title: The traditional crafts in danger of dying out
description: Who was the last British deckle-maker? Who makes withy pots? And what is an orrery?

title: Why this black drive-in cinema is a big hit
description: Drive-ins are booming, of course. But this one is also responding to the other big story of the year.

title: Reading and Leeds Festival to have two main stages on each site in 2021
description: The festivals' organisers said it was their "most epic plan yet" to help ensure they can go ahead.

title: Coronavirus: Tango competitors take to the living room floor
description: The Buenos Aires World Tango Championship took place online because of the pandemic.

title: Snowdon rubbish: 200 bags collected by volunteers
description: About 600,000 people visit the mountain each year but many do not take their rubbish home with them.

title: Europe's migrant crisis: Is Greece still a gateway to Europe?
description: Migrant numbers are rising again, but Greece does not want to be seen as a gateway to Europe.

title: Coronavirus: 'Covidiots' criticised on Tui quarantine flight
description: Mask rules ignored by some on a flight that left nearly 200 facing self-isolation, passenger claims.

title: Spurs face trip to Lokomotiv Plovdiv in Europa League qualifying
description: Tottenham are drawn away to Bulgarian side Lokomotiv Plovdiv in the second round of Europa League qualifying.

title: Pranab Mukherjee: Former India president dies after Covid diagnosis
description: Pranab Mukherjee had a long political career and also served on the boards of IMF and World Bank.

title: Surrey Quays heart attack victim thanks PC who saved his life
description: PC Mitch Howton spent 23 minutes performing CPR on Rui Andrade when he collapsed.

title: Paul Rusesabagina: Hotel Rwanda film hero arrested
description: Paul Rusesabagina's efforts to save people during the Rwanda genocide were depicted in a film.

title: Coronavirus in Scotland: Nicola Sturgeon 'concerned' over 160 new cases
description: Scotland's first minister voices concerns about a fresh increase in coronavirus cases.

title: Seven key moments from the MTV VMAs: Lady Gaga, Taylor Swift, The Weeknd and more
description: Lady Gaga spoke about the 'wrath' and 'rage' of art at the ceremony, dedicated to Chadwick Boseman.

title: What was Edinburgh's Royal Mile like without the festivals?
description: The Royal Mile still attracts street performers and tourists but businesses are suffering.

title: Man City, Chelsea, Burnley... which English club might suit Messi best?
description: Manchester City is the obvious choice, but where else might Lionel Messi feel at home if he moves to England?

title: French magazine condemned for showing black MP as a slave
description: A right-wing French magazine accused of racism apologises to black socialist MP Danièle Obono.

title: Price of plastic carrier bags in England to double to 10p next year
description: The fee for single-use bags will rise to 10p and be extended to all shops from April 2021.

title: Coronavirus: Push back GCSE and A-level exams, says Labour
description: Exams due in May in England should be pushed back as late as July for more catch-up teaching, the party says.

title: Coronavirus: Norway bunker partygoers poisoned with carbon monoxide
description: A "Rave Cave" party in the Norwegian capital Oslo leaves 25 people in need of hospital treatment.

title: Hong Kong protests: The flashpoints in a year of anger
description: A few defining moments in the city’s dramatic year are under the spotlight as arrests gather pace.

title: Coronavirus: Last day for the Eat Out to Help Out discount
description: Businesses want the scheme to be extended, saying October and November are the "biggest worry".

title: Portland protests: Trump and Biden clash over street violence
description: A man was shot dead in the city on Saturday, which has seen weeks of demonstrations.
